intro: Isatis canescens, commonly known as wild mustard, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring alternate, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, while the seed pods are elongated and contain several seeds. Isatis canescens is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
